title.narrative: KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluation, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

participating-org.narrative: ASOCIACION SERVICIO JESUITA PARA MIGRANTES COSTA RICA
FUNDACION DE UNIVERSIDAD COSTA RICA PARA LA INVESTIGACION

sector.narrative: Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C: Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting
Research, monitoring, evaluation and knowledge management for SBC
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/003 SOCIAL INCLUSION, PUBLIC ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue andevidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and thereduction of their main inequalities.

description.narrative: Supported interventions and strategies resulted in enhanced institutional capacities for evidence-based decision-making on child-centered public spending, programs, and policies designed to reduce inequalities affecting children and women. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: The State of the Rights of Children and Adolescents Report (EDNA) elaborated, and strengthened its approach towards the identification and analysis of inequalities and vulnerabilities(57827)

baseline.value: Elaborated the proposal to improve the EDNA.

actual.value: 2019:In process the dissemination strategy of EDNA.

title.narrative: The State of the Rights of Children and Adolescents Report (EDNA) elaborated, and strengthened its approach towards the identification and analysis of inequalities and vulnerabilities(57827)

baseline.value: Elaborated the proposal to improve the EDNA.

actual.value: 2019:In process the dissemination strategy of EDNA.

title.narrative: A proposal for strengthening the Observatory on Children and Adolescents elaborated.(57877), Text

baseline.value: The Childhood and Adolescence Observatory is working within PANI.

target.value: 2022:The country benefits from a strengthened Childhood and Adolescence Observatory that produces key information for the childhood and adolescent institutional sector, using the INECs Subsystem for Chil

actual.value: 2021:UAPINA implemented in the second half of the year

title.narrative: The Children and Adolescent Wellbeing Index (IBINA) methodologic proposal elaborated.(57829)

baseline.value: The IBINA was prepared in 2014 from census data. The desired methodological proposal aims at calculating a new IBINA from administrative data produced biannually.

target.value: 2019:The country has access to data concerning children and adolescent's wellbeing at the municipal level and uses it for national and local planning processes.

title.narrative: The Children and Adolescent Wellbeing Index (IBINA) methodologic proposal elaborated.(57829)

baseline.value: The IBINA was prepared in 2014 from census data. The desired methodological proposal aims at calculating a new IBINA from administrative data produced biannually.

target.value: 2019:The country has access to data concerning children and adolescent's wellbeing at the municipal level and uses it for national and local planning processes.

title.narrative: Proposal for a monitoring system of public investment on children and adolescents elaborated.(57830), Text

baseline.value: The country does not have the methodology and mechanisms for measuring public investment on children and adolescents.

target.value: 2022:The country will have the methodological tools and systems installed for measuring public investment on children and adolescents.

actual.value: 2021:The First Investment report on children and adolescents published

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children, Text

baseline.value: The country has initiated a dialogue on the need to invest better in Childhood.

target.value: 2022:Within the framework of the analysis of fiscal policy, the UNICEF Costa Rica Office will support the development of a methodology to measure investment in children and adolescents.

actual.value: 2021:Methodology for measuring public investment in children was consolidated and results monitored.
